title: How much is the EuroMillions jackpot this Friday now the £169m has been won?
text:
The £167 million EuroMillions jackpot has been claimed, but there’s still millions to be won. (Picture: Victoria Jones/PA Wire)

Just because the mega EuroMillions jackpot has been won by one lucky member of the British public, it doesn’t mean that the chances of becoming a millionaire by playing the lottery are now over.

Yes you might not be as rich as Ed Sheeran in one fell swoop and you might not be able to claim the title of richest lottery winner in the UK ever, but you could still become a millionaire overnight if you happen to pick the right numbers on your ticket.

The EuroMillions continues this week with another draw on Friday following the mega win last night and you can already buy tickets to enter the next draw.

So, how much is the EuroMillions jackpot this Friday now the £169 million prize has been won?

How much is the EuroMillions jackpot this Friday?

Advertisement

Advertisement

The EuroMillions jackpot for this Friday may not be anywhere near to the £169 million pocketed by a UK resident this week, but it’s still a life-changing amount of money.

The estimated sum up for grabs in the draw this Friday is £15 million.

The National Lottery EuroMillions results from Friday 20th September 2019

(Picture: The National Lottery)

If no one matches all five numbers and the two lucky stars in Friday night’s draw, then the jackpot will rollover and the pot of money up for grabs will increase.

This week’s jackpot was so high because the weekly prize money kept rolling over when no numbers were matched. It reached the jackpot total limit this week, meaning that the money had to be won in Tuesday night’s draw.

Lottery history was made in Tuesday’s EuroMillions draw (Picture: AFP/Getty)

The next EuroMillions draw for the £15 million jackpot will be on Friday 11 October.

If you want to take part, EuroMillions ticket sales close at 7:30pm on Tuesdays and Fridays ahead of that evening’s draw.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

description: Just because the mega EuroMillions jackpot has been won it doesn’t mean your chances of becoming a millionaire through the lottery are over.
